title: Carrots and Turnips with Marsala
introduction: Sweet, nutty-tasting Marsala enhances the flavor of root vegetables like carrots and turnips. This dish combines the earthy taste of these vegetables with the aromatic richness of Marsala wine, making for a delightful side dish that pairs well with a variety of main courses.
instructions: Peel the carrots and turnips and cut them into 1-inch pieces.
In a large skillet, melt the butter over medium heat. Add the vegetables and salt to taste. Cook for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Add the Marsala. Cover and cook 5 minutes more or until the wine evaporates and the vegetables are tender. Sprinkle with parsley and serve immediately.
